body_html:
For the training decoder, you don't need output_fn do you? You just run
the training decoder to get some values, and then matmul those to get your
final output (when training). No? Am I wrong?

On Tue, Nov 8, 2016 at 3:16 PM, Alexander Rosenberg Johansen <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

I will make another big commit for Thursday. Thanks for your patience :)

The current architecture is dependent on the output projection wrapper. If
we remove it, we need to reinstate the output_fn.

The value comparison for the test case is a little complicated as we don't
know the embeddings chosen by the random initialized decoder under
inference. But maybe if we switch the order and do inference first. I will
try it out.

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

body:
For the training decoder, you don't need output_fn do you?  You just run
the training decoder to get some values, and then matmul those to get your
final output (when training).  No?  Am I wrong?

On Tue, Nov 8, 2016 at 3:16 PM, Alexander Rosenberg Johansen <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I will make another big commit for Thursday. Thanks for your patience :)
> 
> The current architecture is dependent on the output projection wrapper. If
> we remove it, we need to reinstate the output_fn.
> 
> The value comparison for the test case is a little complicated as we don't
> know the embeddings chosen by the random initialized decoder under
> inference. But maybe if we switch the order and do inference first. I will
> try it out.
> 
> —
